properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 12:18AM CST until January 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Winter Storm Continues into Saturday...

.Snow has transitioned to a wintry mix of freezing rain and sleet
across much of eastern Iowa and west central Illinois. This
transition will continue to move across northwest Illinois the
rest of the evening. Overnight, the freezing rain and sleet may
taper off to freezing drizzle. Total snow and sleet accumulations
of 2 to 6 inches are likely, along with ice accumulations up to
two tenths of an inch. Strong southeast winds gusting up to 30 to
35 MPH through this evening when combined with the falling
precipitation will further reduce visibilities and cause
dangerous traveling conditions. By Saturday morning, very strong
northwest winds gusting to 40 to 45 MPH will lead to blowing and
drifting snow with greatly reduced visibility. These winds will
combine with falling temperatures to produce wind chills down to
10 below zero to 20 below zero during the evening hours Saturday.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow and sleet
accumulations of an inch or less. Total ice accumulations of a
tenth to three tenths possible. Northwest winds gusting up to 40
mph on Saturday.

* WHERE...Bureau and Putnam Counties.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM CST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Difficult travel due to snow covered or icy roads.
Patchy blowing snow could reduce visibilities on Saturday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The weight of the ice combined with the
strong winds on Saturday could bring down tree branches and
lead to isolated power outages.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Go to www.gettingaroundillinois.com for road conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST SATURDAY
